docs.snippet: The educational department of the Grace Line announced yesterday that the response of American students to this year's roster of educational cruises to South American ports was unprecedented, and that additional cruises had been added for students...
docs.lead_paragraph: The educational department of the Grace Line announced yesterday that the response of American students to this year's roster of educational cruises to South American ports was unprecedented, and that additional cruises had been added for students and post-graduate workers interested in Chile and Peru.
docs.abstract: repts on educ cruises to South Amer

headline.main: U.S. STUDENTS FLOCK TO SOUTH AMERICA; Grace Line Says Response to Educational Cruises Is Unprecedented ADDITIONAL VOYAGES SET 400 Will Leave Soon on 3 Ships to Study in Chile and Peru During Stop-Overs

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 10 -- Both exports to and imports from Latin-American and British Empire countries increased considerably in March over February, trade with these areas accounting largely for the 18 per cent export gain for the month, the Department...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 10 -- Both exports to and imports from Latin-American and British Empire countries increased considerably in March over February, trade with these areas accounting largely for the 18 per cent export gain for the month, the Department of Commerce reported today.

headline.main: EXPORTS RISE 18% TO BEST FOR YEAR; March Total of $357,000,000 Due Largely to Latin America and British Empire TRADE WITH EUROPE LIGHT Month's Imports Up to Highest in Almost 4 Years -- Shipments Off to Japan and China

docs.snippet: BERLIN, May 11 -- The interest with which Germany is watching the economic situation in Latin America is evidenced by the fact that the Berlin Institute for Business Research devotes the whole of its latest weekly bulletin to an analysis of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, May 11 -- The interest with which Germany is watching the economic situation in Latin America is evidenced by the fact that the Berlin Institute for Business Research devotes the whole of its latest weekly bulletin to an analysis of the difficulties experienced by the Latin-American nations as a result of the loss of their European markets through the British blockade.
docs.abstract: Berlin Inst of Business Research analyzes Latin Amer trade situation; German semi-official news agency criticizes U S policy

docs.snippet: Welcomed at City Hall by Mayor La Guardia "as representatives of sister republics in a hemisphere where the smallest sovereign state enjoys equal rights with the largest," high naval officers of eleven Central and South American countries arrived...
docs.lead_paragraph: Welcomed at City Hall by Mayor La Guardia "as representatives of sister republics in a hemisphere where the smallest sovereign state enjoys equal rights with the largest," high naval officers of eleven Central and South American countries arrived from Philadelphia at 4:15 o'clock yesterday afternoon for a three-day visit to New York.
